node.title: Almanac: The 1952 premiere of "Singin' in the Rain"
node.description: Seventy years ago, the film regarded as perhaps the greatest Hollywood musical ever – a Technicolor love letter to Hollywood starring Gene Kelly and Debbie Reynolds – debuted.
node.content: ["And now, a page from our \"Sunday Morning\" Almanac: March 27, 1952, 70 years ago today\u2026", "\u2026 the day \"Singin' in the Rain\" sang and danced its way onto the big screen, and into our hearts.\u00a0", "A love story set at the dawn of talking pictures, the film is regarded as perhaps the greatest Hollywood musical ever.\u00a0 ", " Gene Kelly, Donald O'Connor and Debbie Reynolds perform \"Good Morning\": ", "For 19-year-old newcomer Debbie Reynolds, that acclaim didn't come easy. She told \"Sunday Morning\" in 2013, \"We danced 10, 12 hours every day. My feet were bleeding, and I had fainted, and I was just exhausted.\"", "She wasn't alone!", "Donald O'Connor required three days of bed rest after filming the \"Make 'Em Laugh\" sequence: ", "... and Gene Kelly shot the movie's joyous title number with a 103-degree fever: ", "All the same, seven decades on, \"Singin' in the Rain\" remains as vivid a depiction as any of the delirious bliss of falling in love. ", "\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0For more info:", "\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0Story produced by Robert Marston. Editor: Kevin McLaughlin.", "\u00a0 \u00a0 \u00a0See also:\u00a0"]
